required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Analgesic Efficiency Between IPACK Block and Surgical Infiltration After Total Knee Arthroplasty
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Analgesic Efficiency Between IPACK Block (Interspace Between the Popliteal Artery and the Capsule of the Posterior Knee) and Surgical Infiltration After Total Knee Arthroplasty

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this retrospective study is to compare the analgesic efficiency of IPACK block (Interspace between the Popliteal Artery and the Capsule of the posterior Knee) with surgical infiltration after total knee arthroplasty. The main objective is to compare cumulative morphine consumption the first 24 hours after surgery. The secondary objectives are to compare pain scores, types and amounts of other analgesics needed during the first 24 hours after surgery.

detailed_description.textblock:
After patient agreement, data will be collected on patient records and will be compared into 2 groups.
Data will be :
- cumulative consumption of morphine during the first 24 hours after surgery
- pain scores during the first 24 hours after surgery
- amount of analgesics during the first 24 hours after surgery
- maximal pain score during the first 24 hours after surgery

primary_outcome.description: Morphine consumption during the first 24 hours after total knee arthroplasty

secondary_outcome.measure: Pain scores in the recovery room
secondary_outcome.description: Pain scores in the recovery room during the first 24 hours after surgery using the EVA scale
maximal pain score during the first 24 hours after surgery using the EVA scale
types of other analgesics needed during the first 24 hours after surgery
amount other analgesics needed during the first 24 hours after surgery

intervention.intervention_name: Injection of local anesthetics during total knee arthroplasty by a locoregional anesthesia named IPACK block
intervention.description: Injection of local anesthetics during total knee arthroplasty by a locoregional anesthesia named IPACK block (Interspace between the Popliteal Artery and the Capsule of the posterior Knee)

intervention.intervention_name: Injection of local anesthetics during total knee arthroplasty by surgical infiltration
intervention.description: Injection of local anesthetics during total knee arthroplasty by surgical infiltration.

study_pop.textblock: All adults patients after a total knee arthroplasty

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion criteria:
- All adults patients after a total knee arthroplasty since november 2015
Exclusion criteria:
- Child, non primitive surgery
